description: Ms. codex. Title from leaf 1b, line 7. Physical description: 17 lines per page; written in small naskh in black on glazed, laid European paper. Rubrication and catchwords; some marginal notes. Spaces left for rubrication not completely filled in. Damp-stained across lower margin and bottom lines of text. Origin: According to Mach, 16th or 17th century. Incipit: احمد الله على سابغ نعمته ... وبعد ذلك فانه تکرر من جماعة من الاصحاب
author: Muḥaqqiq al-Ḥillī, Jaʻfar ibn al-Ḥasan, 1205 or 1206-1277
extent: 48 leaves : paper ; 200 x 149 (150 x 80) mm bound to 200 x 151 mm
title: Mukhtaṣar fī al-uṣūl.
creator: محقق الحلي، جعفر بن الحسن، 1205 or 1206-1277
subject: Islamic law—Interpretation and construction—Early works to 1800
binding_note: Three-quarter leather with green paper covers.
member_of_collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
